content:
• Thursday, June 21, 2012
  • JAGGF

    Jaguar Mining (NYSE:JAG) +4% AH after naming director and 40-year mining industry vet John...

    Jaguar Mining (NYSE:JAG) +4% AH after naming director and 40-year mining industry vet John Andrews its interim CEO. Jaguar, which in May finished a strategic review after failing to find a buyer, also says it expects to find a permanent CEO by Q3, and demands activist investor Bristol Investment Partners (owns an 8.6% stake) amend a recently-filed 13D on account of alleged inaccuracies.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 PM
  • MNST

    Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) +3.1% AH on news it will be replacing Sara Lee (SLE) in the...

    Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) +3.1% AH on news it will be replacing Sara Lee (SLE) in the S&P 500 as of the close of trading on June 28.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • CS

    More on the Moody's banking downgrades: A three-notch cut for CS. Two-notch rating cuts for JPM,...

    More on the Moody's banking downgrades: A three-notch cut for CS. Two-notch rating cuts for JPM, C, MS, GS; just one notch for BAC. After hours: MS +3.7%; JPM +1%; BAC +1%; C +0.6%. (full statement)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM | 15 Comments
  • HNR

    Shares of Harvest Natural Resources (NYSE:HNR) soar after it says its wholly-owned subsidiary,...

    Shares of Harvest Natural Resources (NYSE:HNR) soar after it says its wholly-owned subsidiary, HNR Energia, has signed a $725M Share Purchase Agreement with PT Pertamina, or Persero, the national oil company of Indonesia, to sell all of the Company's interests in Venezuela in an all-cash transaction. Shares +84% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM | 3 Comments
  • R

    Ryder (NYSE:R) cuts its Q2 and FY12 guidance due to lower than expected results in its Fleet...

    Ryder (NYSE:R) cuts its Q2 and FY12 guidance due to lower than expected results in its Fleet Management Solutions business segment and unusually high medical benefit costs. It now expects it Q2 EPS to be between $0.90 - $0.95, and its FY12 EPS to come in around $3.65 - $3.85. The Street consensus is for its Q2 EPS to be $1.10 and FY12 at $4.09. Shares -8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • QRVO

    Backing up a recent Jefferies note, Digitimes reports many top phone vendors (nearly everyone...

    Backing up a recent Jefferies note, Digitimes reports many top phone vendors (nearly everyone besides Apple) have slashed their orders to Taiwanese suppliers, with the cutbacks expected to continue into Q3. Slowing North American smartphone growth and weak Euro phone demand are seen as the culprits. Some component suppliers saw big losses today - RFMD -6.5%, SWKS -5.4%, TQNT -6.6%, QCOM -3.3% - but then again, so did many other chip stocks (SOXX -4.1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • MMR

    McMoRan Exploration (NYSE:MMR) says it expects to see approximately a $56M charge in its June...

    McMoRan Exploration (NYSE:MMR) says it expects to see approximately a $56M charge in its June quarter due to the expiration of its Boudin lease at Eugene Island Block 26. The company had requested a lease extension from the Department of the Interior to provide it with additional time to assess potential alternatives for a completion, but it was denied. Shares -4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • CY

    Ramtron (RMTR +2.2%) issues a PR stating it will review Cypress Semi's (CY -5.3%) $2.68/share...

    Ramtron (RMTR +2.2%) issues a PR stating it will review Cypress Semi's (CY -5.3%) $2.68/share all-cash tender offer, which is good through July 19. Ramtron closed at $2.81 today, which suggests a higher offer is expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • SDRL

    Investors prospecting for yields might want to drill into SeaDrill (SDRL -3.3%), where...

    Investors prospecting for yields might want to drill into SeaDrill (SDRL -3.3%), where they’ll find a 9.9% dividend yield. HSBC thinks that’s appealing, as it upgrades shares to Overweight from Neutral due to a sound fundamental backdrop and equity market weakness; the firm also notes structural growth in the subsea installation market.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 5 Comments
  • CHK

    Depressed shares of Chesapeake Energy (CHK -4.2%) are worth more than $50 apiece and will...

    Depressed shares of Chesapeake Energy (CHK -4.2%) are worth more than $50 apiece and will eventually top $100, the head of top CHK shareholder Southeastern Asset Management says, adding that the company is on track to sell assets and create a "pristine" balance sheet.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 28 Comments
  • GCI

    Gannett (GCI +3.2%) is one of the days leading gainers in the S&P 500 in a largely downbeat...

    Gannett (GCI +3.2%) is one of the days leading gainers in the S&P 500 in a largely downbeat day for stocks. The company backed its financial projections at an analysts meeting earlier today, adding that plans to revive its publishing business were also going smoothly. The stock has been beaten down recently, losing 13% over the past three months.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • NAV

    Navistar International (NAV -7%) recently interviewed financial advisors including Credit Suisse...

    Navistar International (NAV -7%) recently interviewed financial advisors including Credit Suisse (CS -3.5%), JPMorgan (JPM -2%), and Bank of America Merrill Lynch (BAC -3.3%) for defensive advice. One source says that it's unlikely the company is looking to sell, but appears to be mulling a number of options to deal with defensive tactics against opportunistic moves by third parties to acquire the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • SNBR

    Mattress stocks see another underperforming day after Bed Bath & Beyond's tepid guidance set...

    Mattress stocks see another underperforming day after Bed Bath & Beyond's tepid guidance set the tone in the home furnishings sector. Select Comfort (SCSS -7.5%), Tempur-Pedic (TPX -5.2%), Sealy (ZZ -4.9%), and Mattress Firm (MFRM -6.6%) are all taking it on the chin as shares start to get evaluated by investors more on fundamentals than momentum.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • ECA

    Encana’s (ECA -8.2%) planned $600M capital spending increase will take its 2012 capex to...

    Encana’s (ECA -8.2%) planned $600M capital spending increase will take its 2012 capex to $3.5B, which worries investors since ECA’s forecast 2012 cash flow also is $3.5B and its 2013 capex forecast has been raised to $4B-$5B on cash flow of $2.5B-$3.5B. That’s a big bet, and natural gas prices almost certainly must rise for the bet to pay off.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • WEX

    Wright Express (WXS -4%) takes a hit on an earlier downgrade to Sell at Citigroup, citing...

    Wright Express (WXS -4%) takes a hit on an earlier downgrade to Sell at Citigroup, citing pressures from declining fuel prices and a lack of new contract announcements. The firm sees near-term downside and lowers its price target to $56 from $63.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • XOM

    ExxonMobil (XOM -3%) says it will reconfigure its Fawley refinery, Britain's largest,...

    ExxonMobil (XOM -3%) says it will reconfigure its Fawley refinery, Britain's largest, permanently decommissioning a crude distillation unit, following other European refiners that have been shut due to the fall in fuel demand in the region since 2008. Fawley has a capacity to process 330K bbl/day; the capacity of the unit to be decommissioned is believed to be ~80K bbl/day.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • PBR

    Brazil is studying a gasoline price increase of up to 10%, its mines and energy minister...

    Brazil is studying a gasoline price increase of up to 10%, its mines and energy minister reportedly says. That's good news and bad news for Petrobras (PBR -2.8%), which is counting on the government hiking fuel prices for the first time since 2008 but whose preliminary five-year investment plan suggested it was expecting a 15% raise in revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM

  • BAE Systems (BAESY.PK -1%) dips after being downgraded to Neutral at Citigroup, saying...

    BAE Systems (BAESY.PK -1%) dips after being downgraded to Neutral at Citigroup, saying aggressive shareholder returns look unlikely and growth looks illusive. Citi cites concerns over negative publicity risk surrounding its sequestration into H2 and an overall lack of catalysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • APOG

    Apogee Enterprises (APOG +5.3%) pops after its Q1 beat estimates across the board yesterday,...

    Apogee Enterprises (APOG +5.3%) pops after its Q1 beat estimates across the board yesterday, swinging to a profit as the industrial-glass maker's margins strengthened and as its architectural segment continued to benefit from higher prices and volume growth. The company also raised its full-year earnings outlook, now projecting to earn between $0.40 - $0.58 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • BRDCF

    Tire stocks trade lower after Bridgestone (OTCPK:BRDCF) warns that it may reduce its H2...

    Tire stocks trade lower after Bridgestone (OTCPK:BRDCF) warns that it may reduce its H2 production, with the usual suspects - Europe and China - the rationale behind the cuts. Decliners: CTB -2.6%, GT -3.6%, OTCQB:AMTY -6.9%, OTCPK:MGDDF -6.9% in Paris trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • CMEDQ

    China Medical (CMEDY.OB) +14.8% and has now recovered steep losses it made on Friday and Monday...

    China Medical (CMEDY.OB) +14.8% and has now recovered steep losses it made on Friday and Monday following news that bondholders had filed a petition for liquidation. With remarkable prescience, SA contributor Paul Nouri wrote last week that shorting the stock was a "significant risk," citing the mysterious accumulation of $100M of shares by two unknown investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • CHK

    Adding former Conoco boss Archie Dunham as chairman brings another M&A master to...

    Adding former Conoco boss Archie Dunham as chairman brings another M&A master to Chesapeake's (CHK -3%) lineup, and begs the question of whether a larger deal is in the offing. The five new board members bump up the board's average age, prompting conjecture that directors who aren't going to stick around might be more receptive to selling the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 3 Comments
  • GMCR

    Coffee stocks trade lower as a group after arabica coffee futures march up and analysts say...

    Coffee stocks trade lower as a group after arabica coffee futures march up and analysts say uncooperative weather in India could cut into this year's harvest and potential export tallies from the nation: Decliners: GMCR -5.1%, JVA -1.6%, SBUX -1.4%, PEET -7.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • LYSCF

    Australian miner Lynas (OTCPK:LYSCF -12%) gives back all of the gains it made following...

    Australian miner Lynas (OTCPK:LYSCF -12%) gives back all of the gains it made following parliamentary approval in Malaysia on Tuesday of a controversial rare earths processing facility. A coalition of groups opposing the plant today vowed "wave after wave" of protests that they won't stop until "the world’s largest radioactive dump" is forced out.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • INVN

    InvenSense (INVN -6.8%) slumps after disclosing Ram Krishnan, its operations chief  for the...

    InvenSense (INVN -6.8%) slumps after disclosing Ram Krishnan, its operations chief  for the last 5 years, intends to retire at the end of July. Krishnan recently sold 50K InvenSense shares, a quarter of his stake. InvenSense was crushed in May due to the poor FQ1 guidance accompanying its FQ4 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • DCT

    DCT Industrial (DCT -2.4%) slips on a downgrade to Underperform on valuation at Wells Fargo,...

    DCT Industrial (DCT -2.4%) slips on a downgrade to Underperform on valuation at Wells Fargo, citing challenges from non-core assets. The firm maintains its $5.50 - $6.00 price target range.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • RHT

    Red Hat (RHT -5.7%) has pared the AH losses seen yesterday after reporting a soft deferred...

    Red Hat (RHT -5.7%) has pared the AH losses seen yesterday after reporting a soft deferred revenue figure and FQ2 guidance to go with its FQ1 beat, but remains down sharply. The numbers are heightening existing fears about an IT spending slowdown, stoked by recent comments from Cisco, Dell, and NetApp. Citi is defending Red Hat, arguing the company's June 27 analyst day will be a positive catalyst. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • KEG

    Key Energy (KEG -11.7%) shares are slammed after the company's guidance cut, and RBC warns...

    Key Energy (KEG -11.7%) shares are slammed after the company's guidance cut, and RBC warns of further share downside if oil and the rig count continue to fall. The firm notes pricing pressures and lower utilization levels are spreading to other NAM business lines outside of pressure pumping, as gains in oil/liquids activity have not been able to fully offset the drop in dry gas activity.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • MDAS

    MedAssets (MDAS +1.8%) moves up on an upgrade to Buy at UBS, saying the company's RCM segment...

    MedAssets (MDAS +1.8%) moves up on an upgrade to Buy at UBS, saying the company's RCM segment growth will accelerate, and when combined with SCM execution it should drive shares higher. The firm raises its price target to $18 from $14.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • HES

    Hess (HES -3.8%) reaches deals with Malaysian national oil company Petronas to develop the North...

    Hess (HES -3.8%) reaches deals with Malaysian national oil company Petronas to develop the North Malay Basin, and will invest ~$250M in the project this year and ~$400M/year during 2013-15. HES will have a 50% working interest and operate the project, which is expected to add discovered net resources of 80M-100M boe to its portfolio.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 3 Comments
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL +4%), which has fallen sharply since late April, rallies after Goldman...

    Universal Display (PANL +4%), which has fallen sharply since late April, rallies after Goldman reiterates a Buy and $61 PT. The firm says Korean checks indicate the company is increasing its OLED display materials share with top customer Samsung, and may announce a manufacturing tie-up with a local firm. Goldman thinks a higher materials share, together with the bigger OLED displays of recent Samsung phones, could increase PANL's revenue/device by 4x-5x. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • P

    Pandora (P -8.3%) slides after an NYT column goes over the arrival of new competition from...

    Pandora (P -8.3%) slides after an NYT column goes over the arrival of new competition from Spotify and Songza. The column discusses the possibility Songza's manually-created playlists could be more effective than Pandora's algorithm-based approach at delivering the type of music a user wants to listen to at a particular moment.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • POZN

    Roth Capital weighs in on Pozen (POZN -15%) after the FDA asked drug developer to provide...

    Roth Capital weighs in on Pozen (POZN -15%) after the FDA asked drug developer to provide additional information about its potentially less gastro-erosive aspirin, saying the shares should be bought on the weakness. Roth thinks the company will still be able to file an application for the drug with the FDA by the end of the year. The firm maintains a $10 target and Buy rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • CELG

    SA contributor Valuentum joins Bernstein in defending Celgene (CELG -11.9% to $59.15), which is...

    SA contributor Valuentum joins Bernstein in defending Celgene (CELG -11.9% to $59.15), which is hurting badly following its EU Revlimid bombshell today. Valuentum says the share is undervalued and is attractive at below $65. "Firms that generate a free cash flow margin above 5% are usually considered cash cows." Celgene's 3-year average is 30.6% .
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • AUQ

    AuRico Gold (AUQ -2.8%), fresh off its $1.3B purchase of Northgate Minerals, says it’s...

    AuRico Gold (AUQ -2.8%), fresh off its $1.3B purchase of Northgate Minerals, says it’s focused on its existing assets and will be “opportunistic” in considering further deals. CEO Rene Marion expects M&A activity in the gold mining industry will accelerate because gold stocks are trading more cheaply while new mines are becoming more expensive to build.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • ASRT

    DepoMed (DEPO +1.6%) gains after being added to the Focus List at Roth Capital this morning....

    DepoMed (DEPO +1.6%) gains after being added to the Focus List at Roth Capital this morning. Roth says the stock's risk/reward is favorable given its present valuation and a number of catalysts including: its update on Gralise's orphan drug status, Janumet XR royalties, Glumetza numbers and Serada news flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • QNST

    QuinStreet (QNST +4.2%) trades higher with word that it will be added to the S&P 600 helping...

    QuinStreet (QNST +4.2%) trades higher with word that it will be added to the S&P 600 helping provide support. Shares have been slowly recovering from the shellacking they took when a FQ3 bad debt write off wrecked its FQ3 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • STX

    Hard drive kingpins Seagate (STX -3.8%) and Western Digital (WDC -3.2%) see their low valuations...

    Hard drive kingpins Seagate (STX -3.8%) and Western Digital (WDC -3.2%) see their low valuations fall some more after Morgan Stanley's Katy Huberty slashes her estimates on concerns about PC demand and channel inventories. Huberty expects Q3 price negotiations to be tough for the companies, which have seen favorable pricing thanks to the impact of Thai flooding on industry capacity, and is cutting her Q2 hard drive demand forecast to 156M units from a prior 161M. (Barclays)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • HEI

    HEICO (HEI -3.5%) slides after Credit Suisse cut the shares to Neutral on valuation earlier...

    HEICO (HEI -3.5%) slides after Credit Suisse cut the shares to Neutral on valuation earlier today, citing a slowdown in the company's aftermarket growth. The firm also cuts its price target to $43 from $50.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • EGLE

    Shares of Eagle Bulk Shipping (NASDAQ:EGLE) are now up 45.1% on heavy volume after the company...

    Shares of Eagle Bulk Shipping (NASDAQ:EGLE) are now up 45.1% on heavy volume after the company hashes out a deal with lenders to avoid defaults. Despite the gain, the stock is still over 50% off its 2012 high of $9.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • CELG

    Bernstein comes out defending Celgene (CELG -11.5%) this morning after it takes a hit from...

    Bernstein comes out defending Celgene (CELG -11.5%) this morning after it takes a hit from withdrawing Revlimid's front line and maintenance applications from Europe, saying the stock looks attractive at current levels. The firm expects the E.U. to eventually approve Revlimid and for the stock to recover over the near term. It reiterates its Outperform rating on the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • IAG

    After trying and failing to get a gold mine built in Ecuador over several years, Iamgold (IAG...

    After trying and failing to get a gold mine built in Ecuador over several years, Iamgold (IAG -3.3%) sells its Quimsacocha project to junior miner INV Metals (OTC:ILNLF) for a mere $30M in stock. The project holds more than 3.3M ounces of high-grade gold, but IAG grew weary of dealing with the country's royalty and tax headaches.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • RAD

    Rite Aid (RAD +8.6%) jumps higher after reporting in-line results for FQ1 and adjusting its EPS...

    Rite Aid (RAD +8.6%) jumps higher after reporting in-line results for FQ1 and adjusting its EPS guidance slightly better. Though the numbers weren't dazzling, the drugstore chain operator has shown six straight quarters of increasing same-store sales and has seen the rollout of a loyalty program resonate with consumers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • CIM

    Chimera Investments (CIM -2.9%) is downgraded to Underperform at BAML and to Neutral at Credit...

    Chimera Investments (CIM -2.9%) is downgraded to Underperform at BAML and to Neutral at Credit Suisse in the wake of its dividend cut earlier this week. Chimera is more exposed to credit risk than some of its mREIT brethren as its portfolio has a higher proportion of non-agency-backed MBS.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 15 Comments
  • JNPR

    Juniper (JNPR -3.4%) slumps toward its 52-week low after FBR lowers its PT to $14 from $24 on...

    Juniper (JNPR -3.4%) slumps toward its 52-week low after FBR lowers its PT to $14 from $24 on concerns about the company's product transitions, and its ability to keep pace with Cisco's (NASDAQ:CSCO) latest solutions. Cisco, which poached several Juniper execs last year, has been taking share in the core router and Ethernet switch markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • LF

    LeapFrog (LF +4.8%) treks higher after positive reviews pile in for its new beefed-up...

    LeapFrog (LF +4.8%) treks higher after positive reviews pile in for its new beefed-up educational tablet geared toward children. The device will start selling in the U.S., Canada, U.K., and Ireland beginning next month.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • RIO

    Rio Tinto (RIO -1.8%) can make a strong case for spending a further $4.2B on the expansion of...

    Rio Tinto (RIO -1.8%) can make a strong case for spending a further $4.2B on the expansion of its mining capacity in Western Australia's Pilbara region, which accounts for ~70% of its earnings. Credit Suisse calculates RIO can achieve a 17% IRR at an iron ore price of $90/ton and can reach its target of producing 353M tons from Pilbara by 2015 even with prices as low as $65/ton.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • UAA

    Shares of Under Armour (UA -5.8%) open weak after analysts with UBS clip it with a downgrade to...

    Shares of Under Armour (UA -5.8%) open weak after analysts with UBS clip it with a downgrade to Neutral from Buy. The bearish thesis on UA focuses on valuation that sits too high after a 38% YTD runup in shares and top-line results that look pressured to maintain their high-flying ways.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • SONC

    Shares of Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC) move up 3.3% after the firm's FQ3 report shows sustained momentum...

    Shares of Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC) move up 3.3% after the firm's FQ3 report shows sustained momentum after the company raised prices. On an earnings CC, execs say that its TV commercials featuring "two guys" have been recycled after testing showed the ads helped the Sonic brand.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • MU

    Micron (MU -4.2%) slips after delivering a mixed FQ3 report, and providing cautious comments...

    Micron (MU -4.2%) slips after delivering a mixed FQ3 report, and providing cautious comments about NAND flash memory sales during its earnings call. Not only did Micron disclose its NAND ops posted a loss thanks to massive price declines, it guided for mere high-single-digit trade NAND bit growth in FQ4, which will be more than offset by further price declines. DRAM pricing remains relatively stable. NAND rival SanDisk (SNDK -0.9%) is off slightly.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM
  • MAIN

    Main Street Capital (NYSE:MAIN) droops premarket, -4.8% to $22.59, as it prices a public...

    Main Street Capital (NYSE:MAIN) droops premarket, -4.8% to $22.59, as it prices a public offering of 3.75M shares at $22.50/share - or a net proceeds of about $80.8M. The deal has an overallotment allowance for up to 562,500 extra shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 2 Comments
  • DOLE

    Shares of Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE) rise 7.6% in premarket trading as they bounce off multi-week...

    Shares of Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE) rise 7.6% in premarket trading as they bounce off multi-week lows. The company's majority owner is in the news after he sold 98% of Hawaii's Lanai to Larry Ellison after the island had been a staple of the Dole company for over 90 years.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • ONXX

    Market preview: Stock futures are flat to lower following slightly worse than expected jobless...

    Market preview: Stock futures are flat to lower following slightly worse than expected jobless data, although much of Europe is higher despite more woeful PMI data. S&P Benchmark -0.05%. Onyx (NASDAQ:ONXX) +38% after an FDA panel vote goes its way, although Celgene (NASDAQ:CELG) is -10.8% in the wake of EU regulators asking for more info on Revlimid. Later: Existing Home Sales, Philly Fed Business Outlook
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • ONXX

    Premarket gainers: ONXX +37%. SUNH +36%. EGLE +22%. CHTP +13%. RAD +6%. Losers: KEG -14%. CELG...

    Premarket gainers: ONXX +37%. SUNH +36%. EGLE +22%. CHTP +13%. RAD +6%.
    Losers: KEG -14%. CELG -11%. BBBY -11%. RHT -9%. MAIN -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • BWEN

    Broadwind Energy (NASDAQ:BWEN) +17.6% premarket after Chinese wind energy company Goldwind...

    Broadwind Energy (NASDAQ:BWEN) +17.6% premarket after Chinese wind energy company Goldwind selects it to supply 14 wind turbine towers for its Musselshell project in Montana, set for installation during H2 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • ONXX

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) +38.2% premarket after yesterday's FDA panel vote in favor of...

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) +38.2% premarket after yesterday's FDA panel vote in favor of the company's Kyprolis drug for multiple myeloma. The final FDA approval decision is expected July 27. Shares are upgraded to Outperform from Neutral at Baird, initiated with a Buy at Deutsche Bank, and upgraded to Buy at Brean Murray.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • TJX

    Wells Fargo chimes in on TJX with an upgrade to Outperform from Market Perform and raised...

    Wells Fargo chimes in on TJX with an upgrade to Outperform from Market Perform and raised earnings estimates. The company's T.J. Maxx unit has been one of the biggest beneficiaries from the meltdown at J.C. Penney and the trimming down at Sears. Shares of TJX +1.5% premarket, +33.6% YTD vs. JCP -32.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • CELG

    Celgene (NASDAQ:CELG) -10.2% after EU regulators request more data about widening authorization...

    Celgene (NASDAQ:CELG) -10.2% after EU regulators request more data about widening authorization of the firm's multiple myeloma treatment Revlimid to treat newly diagnosed patients and as a maintenance therapy. Celgene is pulling the submission and will resubmit it with more data, and the firm is "re-evaluating" a similar FDA application. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • KEG

    Key Energy (NYSE:KEG) -10.1% premarket after forecasting FQ2 results to miss its prior...

    Key Energy (NYSE:KEG) -10.1% premarket after forecasting FQ2 results to miss its prior expectations, as KEG now expects earnings from continuing operations at $0.18-$0.20/share vs. prior $0.31-$0.33. KEG also cut full-year projections for U.S. revenue, pointing to lower than expected growth in liquid shale markets this year and a decline in natural gas prices.

  • Tokyo continues its recent advances as a weaker yen supports its exporters, but other regional...
